ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Computes the areas under the precision-recall (PR) and ROC curve for weighted (e.g., soft-labeled) and unweighted data. In contrast to other implementations, the interpolation between points of the PR curve is done by a non-linear piecewise function. In addition to the areas under the curves, the curves themselves can also be computed and plotted by a specific S3-method. References: Davis and Goadrich (2006) <doi:10.1145/1143844.1143874>; Keilwagen et al. (2014) <doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0092209>; Grau et al. (2015) <doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btv153>.

Computes the areas under the precision-recall (PR) and ROC curve for weighted (e.g., soft-labeled) and unweighted data. In contrast to other implementations, the interpolation between points of the PR curve is done by a non-linear piecewise function. In addition to the areas under the curves, the curves themselves can also be computed and plotted by a specific S3-method. References: Davis and Goadrich (2006) <doi:10.1145/1143844.1143874>; Keilwagen et al. (2014) <doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0092209>; Grau et al. (2015) <doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btv153>.

name: r-prroc
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.4" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-prroc
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/PRROC_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/PRROC/PRROC_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 9dbb4a7a9becb5a8f281a05fe263c4c96b187e459f1ed96b27381e838db493b6

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rlang
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rlang

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('PRROC')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('PRROC')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=PRROC
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: 'Computes the areas under the precision-recall (PR) and ROC curve for weighted (e.g., soft-labeled) and unweighted data. In contrast to other implementations, the interpolation between points of the PR curve is done by a non-linear piecewise function. In addition to the areas under the curves, the curves themselves
    can also be computed and plotted by a specific S3-method. References: Davis and Goadrich (2006) <doi:10.1145/1143844.1143874>; Keilwagen et al. (2014) <doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0092209>; Grau et al. (2015) <doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btv153>.'
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: PRROC
# Type: Package
# Title: Precision-Recall and ROC Curves for Weighted and Unweighted Data
# Version: 1.3.1
# Date: 2018-06-19
# Author: Jan Grau and Jens Keilwagen
# Maintainer: Jan Grau <grau@informatik.uni-halle.de>
# Description: Computes the areas under the precision-recall (PR) and ROC curve for weighted (e.g., soft-labeled) and unweighted data. In contrast to other implementations, the interpolation between points of the PR curve is done by a non-linear piecewise function. In addition to the areas under the curves, the curves themselves can also be computed and plotted by a specific S3-method. References: Davis and Goadrich (2006) <doi:10.1145/1143844.1143874>; Keilwagen et al. (2014) <doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0092209>; Grau et al. (2015) <doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btv153>.
# License: GPL-3
# Packaged: 2018-06-19 10:20:18 UTC; dev
# Suggests: testthat, ggplot2, ROCR
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2018-06-19 10:42:55 UTC
